俗.definition: custom; convention; popular; common; coarse; vulgar; secular

俗世.definition: the mundane world; the world of mortals

俗世奇人.definition: Extraordinary people in our ordinary world, short stories by novelist Feng Jicai 馮驥才|冯骥才[Feng2 Ji4 cai2]

俗名.definition: vernacular name; lay name (of a priest)

俗字.definition: nonstandard form of a Chinese character

俗家.definition: layman; layperson; original home of a monk

俗氣.definition: tacky; inelegant; in poor taste; vulgar; banal

俗稱.definition: commonly referred to as; common term

俗話說.definition: as the proverb says; as they say...

俗辣.definition: (slang) (Tw) coward; paper tiger; a nobody (from Taiwanese 卒仔, Tai-lo pr. [tsut-á])

俗隨時變.definition: customs change with time (idiom); other times, other manners; O Tempora, O Mores!

俗體字.definition: nonstandard form of a Chinese character
